lead_paragraph: The rules, which take effect in October 2017, require disclosure of monthly fees and charges for withdrawals, reloading and other activities.

headline.print_headline: New Rules to Protect Users of Prepaid Debit Cards
headline.main: Prepaid Debit Cards Users Will Get New Federal Protections

snippet: The rules, which take effect in October 2017, require disclosure of monthly fees and charges for withdrawals, reloading and other activities....
abstract: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau announces new regulations for prepaid debit cards in order to address consumer complaints; rules, set to begin in 2017, will require issuers to offer standardized, detailed fee disclosure, liability cap of $50 for unauthorized use and to evaluate customer's repayment ability before issuing overdraft line of credit.
